metadata.title: UK Education Events Database 2025-2026
metadata.description: Comprehensive database of UK education events, conferences, awards ceremonies, and professional development opportunities

events.description: Church of England Education Office conference focusing on 'Flourishing Leaders, Flourishing Schools'. Key themes include leadership development, school improvement, and faith-based education.
events.additional_notes: 10:15am - 3:30pm. Includes lunch and refreshments.

events.description: The world's largest educational technology event bringing together over 35,000 educators, policymakers, and industry professionals from 130+ countries. Features 600+ exhibitors and 400+ speakers across seven themed stages.
events.additional_notes: Three days of exhibitions, conferences, and networking. Seven themed stages covering AI, sustainability, and digital transformation.

events.location: University of Oxford Department of Education
events.description: Association for Language Learning conference focusing on teaching listening skills effectively, including phonics teaching, GCSE preparation, AI integration, and using songs for language development.
events.additional_notes: Single day conference with workshops and seminars

events.description: Conference exploring transformation of educational systems, technological advancements, and inclusivity in education. Features keynote speakers and interactive workshops.
events.additional_notes: 9:00am - 4:00pm. Includes exhibition and networking lunch.

events.location: University of London Senate House & Online
events.description: Research in Distance Education conference focusing on online, distance, blended, and digital education in higher education. International conference with academic and practitioner presentations.
events.target_audience: HE professionals, researchers, distance learning specialists
events.organizer: Society for Research into Higher Education (SRHE)
events.additional_notes: Hybrid format with online and in-person attendance options. Theme: 'Empowering and Sustaining Change'

events.description: Full-day conference for primary school teachers and sports providers focusing on PE, Sport and Physical Activity's role in addressing disadvantage and inequality.
events.additional_notes: Keynote speakers: Emma Brown (England Deaf Women's Futsal) and Bryn Llewellyn (Move & Learn CIC founder)

events.description: Collaborative conference between AMET, ATM, MA, NAMA, and NANAMIC with theme 'Future Proofing the Curriculum'. Features diverse range of workshops and talks for mathematics educators.
events.additional_notes: Three-day residential conference with accommodation options available

events.description: Three-day conference with theme 'Connected Geographies' featuring 100+ lectures, workshops, teacher-to-teacher sessions, research papers, and field visits. Includes GA Awards ceremony.
events.additional_notes: Keynote speakers include Dr Anjana Khatwa and Hina Robinson. Field visits included.

events.description: Main decision-making body of the NASUWT union, attended by over 1,000 elected representatives with training sessions, exhibitions, and networking opportunities.

ticket_prices.representatives: Funded travel, accommodation, and meals provided

events.additional_notes: Live streaming of public sessions available. Includes policy debates and union business.

events.description: Joint BCS, CPHC, and UKCRC event for higher education computing community featuring keynotes, panels, and workshops on tech policy, sustainability, and diversity.
events.additional_notes: Focus on navigating change, surviving and thriving in computing education

events.description: Comprehensive two-day programme featuring outstanding keynotes, workshops, general talks, and guided visits. Includes primary, secondary, ITE, and general interest pathways.
events.additional_notes: Keynote speakers include Professor Alexandra Walsham and Professor Diarmaid MacCulloch

events.event_name: SEND Conference at Schools & Academies Show
events.description: Conference for SENCOs and education professionals focusing on inclusive education and SEND provision, co-located with Schools & Academies Show.
events.additional_notes: Co-located with main Schools & Academies Show exhibition

events.description: Free event for all SCITTs and HEIs delivering PE teacher training, covering National Curriculum updates and Curriculum and Assessment Review process.
events.target_audience: PE teacher trainers, SCITT staff, HEI lecturers
events.additional_notes: 10:00am - 3:00pm. Includes lunch and refreshments.

events.description: Annual conference for headteachers and education leaders featuring renowned keynote speakers from business, sport, arts, and education sectors.
events.additional_notes: Two-day conference with networking opportunities and exhibition

events.description: Dubbed the 'Oscars of education,' these awards celebrate outstanding achievements across 23 categories in UK state and independent schools, from early years through secondary education.
events.target_audience: Education professionals, award nominees, school leaders
events.additional_notes: Evening ceremony with dinner. 23 award categories including new 'Inclusive Trust of the Year'

events.description: Heavily subsidized conference featuring keynote from Dr Stephanie Pratt (Crow-Creek Dakota), expert workshops, free resources, and schemes of work.
events.additional_notes: Includes free resources and teaching materials. Travel bursaries available for attendees.

events.event_name: Computing at School North East Conference 2025
events.description: Free regional conference capped at 150 attendees featuring hands-on practical sessions on computing curriculum delivery across all education stages.
events.additional_notes: Practical sessions covering all key stages. Limited places available.

events.description: Virtual conference exploring how to put children's needs at the heart of early years provision. Focus on policy development and best practice sharing.
events.additional_notes: 6:15pm - 8:45pm. Virtual format accessible nationwide.

events.description: National Association for the Teaching of English conference featuring creative approaches to Shakespeare, mindful writing, curriculum reform, oracy, linguistics, and AI in the classroom.
events.organizer: National Association for the Teaching of English (NATE)
events.additional_notes: Focus on creative and innovative English teaching approaches

events.description: One of the UK's most inspiring education events featuring hundreds of speakers and thousands of attendees. Now in its 16th year, covering all aspects of education.
events.additional_notes: Two-day festival format with multiple venues and stages. Includes camping options.

events.description: Advance HE flagship three-day conference for HE practitioners focusing on 'Future-Focused Education: Ensuring successful student outcomes for all'.
events.target_audience: HE teaching staff, learning developers, educational developers
events.additional_notes: Keynotes from Professor Philip Hanna and Professor Louise Archer. Multiple session tracks.

events.description: Premier mathematics education conference featuring over 60 sessions across two days. Keynote speakers include Dr Tom Crawford (University of Oxford/Cambridge), Sarah Hart (Gresham College), and Charlie Stripp (MEI Chief Executive/NCETM Director).
events.additional_notes: 60+ sessions covering all aspects of mathematics education. Networking opportunities included.

events.description: Conference exploring language development through child/adult interactions, featuring Dr Julie Fisher. Focus on communication and interaction strategies in early years settings.
events.target_audience: Early years practitioners, speech and language therapists
events.additional_notes: 3:45pm - 5:45pm. Features Dr Julie Fisher as keynote speaker.

events.event_name: Royal Society Future of Scientific Publishing Conference
events.description: Global leaders in scientific publishing and research discussing current state and future developments in scientific publishing over the next 15 years. Convened 270 key stakeholders from science and publishing communities.
events.additional_notes: Two-day event bringing together global publishing leaders. Free attendance.

events.description: Leading forum for computing education researchers and practitioners with two free pre-conference events on 3 September. UK and Ireland Computing Education Research conference.
events.additional_notes: Pre-conference events on 3 September. Based in Edinburgh with international participants.

events.description: Two-day free event bringing together early years and primary education professionals. Features exhibitions, seminars, and networking opportunities.
events.additional_notes: Two-day exhibition with free seminars and workshops. Midlands location.

events.description: University of Oxford Faculty of Medieval and Modern Languages annual conference providing unique forum for interaction between university and secondary teachers. Theme: 'Collaboration and Connections'.
events.organizer: University of Oxford Faculty of Medieval and Modern Languages
events.additional_notes: Two-day residential conference with college accommodation. University-school collaboration focus.

events.description: Two-day conference focusing on educational infrastructure including funding, design, build, maintenance, and management of educational facilities.
events.additional_notes: Major exhibition alongside conference sessions. Focus on sustainable building practices.

events.description: Two-day conference focusing on AI in Education, eLearning platforms, virtual classrooms, and learning technologies. International speakers and exhibitors.
events.additional_notes: Focus on AI integration in education. International speaker lineup.

events.description: UK's premier event for language learners and teachers featuring nearly 90 live sessions, 100+ speakers, and 55 talks specifically for language teachers. Sessions cover GCSE preparation, AI integration, global citizenship, and practical classroom strategies.
events.target_audience: Language teachers, language learners, MFL coordinators

ticket_prices.early_bird: £13.50 (access to live sessions plus 11 months on-demand)

events.additional_notes: 90 live sessions with 11 months on-demand access. Focus on practical teaching strategies.

events.description: The UK's leading education show for school leaders, featuring 200+ speakers, 40+ hours of CPD content, and 200+ exhibitors. Co-located with EdTech Summit and Independent Schools Conference.

ticket_prices.school_leaders: FREE for those directly employed in education

events.additional_notes: Co-located with multiple education events. 40+ hours of CPD content available.

events.description: Prestigious ceremony bringing together 250+ education pioneers to recognize senior leaders, schools, and multi-academy trusts. Jointly presented by Institute of School Business Leadership (ISBL) and Schools & Academies Show.
events.target_audience: School leaders, award nominees, education pioneers
events.organizer: Institute of School Business Leadership & Schools & Academies Show
events.additional_notes: Evening ceremony at House of Lords. Multiple award categories including SEND Leader of the Year.

events.description: Education's premier recognition event featuring 16 individual and team categories across early years, primary, secondary, and FE sectors. Winners are featured on BBC's The One Show for a week-long celebration.

ticket_prices.ceremony: FREE for nominated individuals and winners
ticket_prices.accommodation: Overnight accommodation in top London hotel provided for winners

events.additional_notes: Evening ceremony with BBC coverage. 16 award categories across all education phases.

events.description: Leading global EdTech event bringing together 35,000+ educators from around the world. Features cutting-edge technology demonstrations, expert speakers, and networking opportunities.
events.additional_notes: Three-day flagship event. 600+ exhibitors and 400+ speakers expected.

events.description: Europe's biggest exhibition for music and drama educators, featuring talks, workshops, and exhibitions from leading suppliers and practitioners.
events.target_audience: Music teachers, drama teachers, arts coordinators
events.additional_notes: Two-day exhibition with workshops and demonstrations. Free for education professionals.

events.description: The UK's largest event for early years education, featuring CPD seminars, workshops, and products from leading early years suppliers.
events.target_audience: Early years practitioners, nursery managers, childminders
events.additional_notes: Two-day exhibition at Olympia London. Free seminars and product demonstrations.

events.description: Main decision-making body of the NASUWT union, attended by over 1,000 elected representatives with training sessions, exhibitions, and networking opportunities.

ticket_prices.representatives: Funded travel, accommodation, and meals provided

events.additional_notes: Travel, accommodation, and meals provided for union representatives. Policy debates and union business.

events.description: Europe's leading workplace learning and technology event, co-located with HR Technologies UK. Features 200+ exhibitors and 200+ free seminars.
events.target_audience: L&D professionals, HR managers, education technology specialists

ticket_prices.conference_passes: Group bookings save £100 per ticket (3+ delegates)

events.additional_notes: 200+ exhibitors and 200+ free seminars. Co-located with HR Technologies.

events.description: Conference for SENCOs and education professionals focusing on inclusive education and SEND provision, co-located with Schools & Academies Show.
events.additional_notes: Co-located with Schools & Academies Show. Focus on inclusive education practices.

events.description: A week-long celebration of global EdTech featuring conferences, hackathons, networking events, and the exclusive EdTechX Summit for 250+ senior industry leaders.

ticket_prices.edtechx_summit: Tickets on sale soon with early bird discounts

events.additional_notes: Week-long series of events across London. EdTechX Summit limited to 250 senior leaders.

events.description: 16th Festival of Education featuring hundreds of speakers and thousands of attendees. One of the UK's most inspiring education events covering all aspects of education.
events.additional_notes: Two-day festival format. Most inspiring education event in the UK.

events.description: International conference encouraging academic dialogue and cross-disciplinary collaboration in education research and practice.
events.additional_notes: Five-day international conference across two prestigious London universities.

events.description: 17th international conference promoting collaborative excellence between academics and professionals in education from around the world.
events.additional_notes: Three-day international conference at Oxford. 17th year of collaborative excellence.

events.description: UK's largest gathering for science education professionals, featuring 220+ sessions in partnership with AQA. Includes extensive CPD opportunities and networking.

ticket_prices.ase_members: Exclusive early bird prices (available until 2 November 2025)

events.additional_notes: 220+ sessions across three days. Partnership with AQA for practical science.

events.description: Three-day conference with theme 'Geography makes a difference' featuring lectures, workshops, field visits, and networking opportunities.
events.additional_notes: Three-day event in Sheffield. Field visits and practical sessions included.

events.description: Two-day programme featuring keynotes, workshops, talks, and guided visits across primary, secondary, and higher education pathways.
events.additional_notes: Two-day programme in Newcastle Gateshead with multiple education pathways.

events.description: Gala awards ceremony recognizing excellence in educational resources and equipment across Early Years, Primary ICT, and various subject categories.
events.additional_notes: Evening gala ceremony recognizing excellence in educational resources.

events.description: 19th annual learning and teaching conference focusing on 'Students at the heart of learning and teaching'. Hybrid format with in-person and online participation.
events.target_audience: HE teaching staff, students, educational developers
events.additional_notes: Day 1 in-person (Greenwich only), Day 2 online (open access). 19th annual conference.

events.description: Conference focusing on creating inclusive learning environments for children with SEND, now in its fourth year. Covers design, accessibility, and facility management.

ticket_prices.education_professionals: FREE for those directly employed in schools, colleges, universities

events.additional_notes: Fourth year of specialist SEND infrastructure conference. Free for education professionals.
